Judul: DESIGN AND FINITE ELEMENT ANALYSIS OF CAGE WHEEL FOR TRACTOR OPERATING ON PEAT SOIL
Abstrak:
Forest restoration projects have become increasingly common around the world and
planting trees is almost always a key component. Low seedling survival and growth may
result in restoration failures and various mechanical site preparation techniques for treatment
of soils and vegetation are important tools used to help counteract this. Beforehand, there is a
process to prepare the land used for the plantation. One of the processes is called ploughing.
Ploughing process is usually done by either conventional tractor or machine power tractor.
The company is located at Sumatra Island and mostly the area there is covered with peat soil.
Peat soil is a type of land that is very commonly used in plantation areas in Indonesia. The
problem that arises is companies that use tractor operation uses cage wheel which cannot
perform efficiently. Previous wheels used by the company weren't effectively used while
working as the wheel is heavy and the shape structure of the wheel makes the soil stuck into
the wheel and gradually will obstruct the process. This research aims to create an optimal new
design of cage wheel that is suitable with Design Requirement & Objective (DR&O) that has
been made, perform static structural analysis of the new design with certain boundary
conditions and loading conditions, then analyze the results of the simulation. The method
used in this research is a finite element method by conducting a modeling process using
Solidworks® and a simulation process using ANSYS. The output of this study is a new cage
wheel design with certain fulfilled requirements that hopefully will give better working
performance when used later by the company.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Dr. Ir. Ignatius Pulung Nurprasetio, M.SME.
Dr. Bentang Arief Budiman, S.T., M.Eng.
Kata Kunci: peat soil, cage wheel, finite element method, ANSYS
